page.title: 10DIALECT IN LLANBISTER
page.content: {The following are examples of {Radnor dialect in use.OONT}MOLE: {OONTY TUMP} MOLE HILL{PISTY}PUP:{EAN TO LAMB:{FFALD}FOLD:{OLLERT}OWL: {SIMPLE}UNWELL:{GLAT}HOLE IN HEDGE: {TROUSE}FOR FILLING GLAT:{TUSH}TO PULL: {DYCHE}DITCH:{LINNO}SUPPLE:{JOURN}KEEN: {TIDY}HONEST:{TIDLING}HANDFED LAMB: {LUG}TO CART HAY:{PITCH}STEEP ROAD: {SLIKE}SLIPPERY:{STARVED}COLD:{CAG}TEAR {FROM OFF}STRANGER:{CATCH HOLT}HELP YOURSELF:{MEX}TO CLEANOUT COWSHED: {MIXEN}MOUND OF COW MANURE:{YOW}EWE: {HOAP HOAP}TO CALL COWS:{TROW}TROUGH: {BA HOAP BA HOAP}TO CALL SHEEP:{SCRAT} SCRATCH:{BRUCK}BROOK:{CLOD}TURF:{WIK} WEEK:{NURSED}BROUGHT UP:{MOULD}SOIL: {FRETCHED}IRRITABLE:{HISHT}HUSH:{PUCK} PICK:{GREET}ON FRIENDLY TERMS:{KIDDLE} TO DRIBBLE:{FETCHOC}POLECAT:{LUMPER} SMALL BOY:{BELLOCK}TO BAWL:{KANK}BAD TEMPER:{BRUMMUCK}BILL HOOK:
